üìö Study Material - Today in History (Feb 14) & National Icons

This study material focuses on the foundation of the Mughal Empire, the legacy of Indian women leaders in politics, and critical internal security milestones.

üëë Mughal History & Coronations:

  • Zahiruddin Muhammad Babur: Born on Feb 14, 1483. He founded the Mughal Empire in India after defeating Ibrahim Lodi in the First Battle of Panipat (1526).
  • Coronation of Akbar: On Feb 14, 1556, at the young age of 13, Akbar was crowned at Kalanaur (Punjab) following the death of Humayun.

üáÆüá≥ Political Icons & Awards:

  • Sushma Swaraj: Born today in 1952. She was India's first full-time female Minister of External Affairs and the first female CM of Delhi. She was posthumously honored with the Padma Vibhushan.
  • Bhimsen Joshi: Birth anniversary of the legendary Hindustani classical vocalist and Bharat Ratna awardee (Kirana Gharana).

üõ°Ô∏è Internal Security & Modern History:

  • Pulwama Martyr's Day: Commemorating the 2019 attack on CRPF personnel. This led to Operation Bandar (Balakot Air Strikes), a key topic for defense-related questions.
  • Bhopal Gas Tragedy Settlement: In 1989, the Supreme Court ordered Union Carbide to pay $470 million in compensation on this date.

Important Topics for Exams:

  • Battles of Babur (Panipat, Khanwa, Chanderi, Ghagra)
  • Padma Awards and Bharat Ratna Recipients
  • First Women in Indian Politics (CMs, Governors, Ministers)
  • Important Battles and Coronations during the Mughal Era
